column4: yes yes i know of pretty much all media players available. ATM  im not asking about players. can you recomend any plugins or whatever that YOU KNOW has speed/pitch changes?
in 7.04, you needed to install the compiz extensions from add/remove software
did you have firefox or epiphany running?
I don't recall- although I'll keep a mental log of what's running the next time it happens
are you registered on freenode?
yes i am, i just replied to you. i might have not identified, let me do that real quick
also   ls -al /dev/disk/
you have a perplexing problem. lol
I was going to say...
I can't figure out how to capture playing audio either- I only have an option to record from a microphone input. =(
have you tried other sound-recording programs?
There are others?!?! :O :O :O  /sarcasm :P
here's the thing. I know in Windows in order to "record what you hear", the sound card had to support a sort of "loopback interface".
Yeah, I ONLY have audor, audacity , gtk record my desktop ,  and sound recorder  -  *wink*
i know how to record sound in windows but im on linux
right. I don't know how Linux/Ubuntu handles audio. If it passes it to the hardware, the card might need a loopback. If it's handled by the OS, then there may be an option to loop it to an "input".
I apreciate the sentiment - though  i dont care either way ;p i just want it to work without having to get a degree in Multimedia LOL!
are you there?
did you get your drive auto-mount issue fixed? Someone was was in here earlier asking how to accomplish the same thing.
I gave up and just  reformated to  ext3, sadly, and then it worked without me doing anything *shrug*
well that's one way to solve it.. >.>
sure puts that guy to shame, the one who told me i needed a shorter usb cable lol wtf!
I guess I missed that part. Although for some drives, that advice could very well have solved it.
